description: Last November I travelled around Japan, it was extremely inspirational for me, I made artwork named “What I brought from Japan instead of a fridge magnet”. The sound of vending machines created an immersive experience pairing with the bold visual effects to show the incredible level of consumption. Sound and image blend in a hectic yet peaceful dynamic.

As part of our ‘Sport is Never Done’ campaign for Nike, we designed an immersive DOOH on one of the world's largest places at Dubai Mall and Riyadh Time Square, Saudi Arabia. ‘Sport is Never Done’, is a campaign challenging parental misconceptions around sports and societal expectations on children, helping families in the Middle East to move more and to move better.
projectTitle:
DOOH CAMPAIGN NIKE SPORT IS NEVER DONE
WIEDEN + KENNEDY

description: PUMA presented home and away uniform sets for the Ukrainian football club Shakhtar (season 2021/2022). The presentation took place in a live broadcast with the participation of club representatives and fans. I worked on a spectacular motion for the film and floor to make the event truly immersive. Studio: seek
projectTitle:
PUMA PLAY IN STYLE
SEEK STUDIO

description: Meet Creature – a creative concept for WeTransfer brought to life by your file transfers. The more you send, the bigger and faster your unique CREATURE grows. Each one is as distinct as the files you feed it, making your transfers an exciting and personalised experience. Team: Shen Hou, Chris Taylor, Serhii Serbi
projectTitle:
DIGITAL CREATURE
AN INTERACTIVE CONCEPT FOR WETRANSFER

description: Exploring Amsterdam Spring from a human perspective and AI perspective. I captured tulips around Amsterdam streets and proceed them through Stable diffusion. From a human standpoint, the streets adorned with tulips create a picturesque scene, embodying the essence of Amsterdam during the vibrant spring season. However, when the AI-generated comes into play, an unexpected twist occurs. The AI's creativity takes over, and the tulips transform into a quirky mix of pots with tourists, marijuana, ice creams, Dutch bitterballens, bicycles, and rubbish. This surreal blend captures the bustling and diverse ambience of Amsterdam during the tourist-packed spring season.
projectTitle:
SPRING IN AMSTERDAM FROM
A HUMAN vs AI PERSPECTIVE

description: My favourite pair of Crocs were stolen on a beach in France, right next to a bag of phones and watches. I always knew that my Crocs attractive thing.

Relaxing virtual journey through Hawaii. This digital wonderland captures the essence of nature's beauty, leaving you with lasting memories of this enchanting escape. Song: Where are the keys??? by Blue Hawaii

Audio reactive motion “Fragile world” As a Ukrainian living in the Netherlands, my world feels like two contrasting parts. Here is calm and stable, while Ukraine, where my family and friends are, is facing danger and suffering due to the Russian invasion. I've created a pattern using audio-reactive noises in TouchDesigner, to express these emotions. Let's raise awareness and stand in solidarity with Ukraine. Music by LYKHO

Last November I travelled around Japan, it was extremely inspirational for me, I made artwork named “What I brought from Japan instead of a fridge magnet”. Fever detection systems have multiplied in the past 3 years in Japan in all public spaces, they also became my digital souvenir from Japan.

Through motion manipulations, I bring my emotions to life in a digital way. Electrophoresis-like movements surge with electric energy, while work notifications buzz. Tears flow, expressing my inner vulnerability, and a storm of emotions swirls within.

description:
Erling Haaland broke the Premier League goalscoring record on May 3rd 2023. A record that has stood for almost 30 years and the Norwegian did it with 7 games to spare, at 22 years of age, in his debut season. A truly phenomenal achievement. 

To celebrate his Premier League goalscoring record, we brought the Aurora Borealis phenomenon to the skies of Manchester.

A phenomenal goalscorer, breaking a phenomenal record deserves a phenomenal moment in footballing history.

Agency: Wieden+Kennedy Amsterdam

projectTitle:
chillaxing ON THE
NORTH SEA COAST

description: Sound-reactive pattern wrapped around the glitchy ball, blending art and technology. Generated in Touch Designer, edited in Cinema 4D, and After Effects. Sound by @matthewtavares

Squeeze your trash! Cпочатку зчави сміття! 先壓垃圾! 為什麼垃圾桶的空間總是不夠用？ 除了減少製造垃圾我們可以在丟垃圾之前 Why is a trash can always not big enough? In addition to reducing waste, we can squeeze our trash before throwing it into a trash can. Чому смітник завжди недостатньо великий? Щоб зменшити кількість відходів, ми можемо зчавити сміття перед тим як викинути його у смітник. Collab with the designer: Shen Hou

Last November I travelled around Japan, it was extremely inspirational for me, I made artwork named “What I brought from Japan instead of a fridge magnet”. The experimental work was shoot at the Shibuya crossing in Tokyo, I was imagining how a big amount of temperature measured people look together.

Mysterious motion graphics on old CRT TVs. Glitchy visuals and cryptic messages create an enigmatic atmosphere. The vintage-style text adds to the intrigue, leaving you curious about the secrets hidden within. Client: Sony Music London

Charity project Ukrainians say thank you

To express gratitude towards people who are standing with Ukraine by showing up at protests, making donations and sharing their homes with refugees, we create a set of downloadable posters and social assets to say: “Дякую” (Thank You) for all the help Ukrainians have been receiving since Russia started the war on 24.02.22. 

Available in 21 languages, the idea is for people to spread messages of appreciation across different cities, in turn reproducing the Ukrainian flag to show solidarity and support. People in 32 countries around the world are already joining in pasting posters around different cities, outside and in shops, companies etc. 

Website: https://ukrainianssay-thankyou.com/ 
Instagram: @ukrainianssay.thankyou

TEAM
Olla Kuzovkina, Dasha Ovechkina, Serhii Serbin
projectTitle:
Ukrainians say: дякую*
*[Dyakuyu] thank you in ukrainian

description: Zero Time - a watch face that defies conventional notions of timekeeping and transports you to a realm of the present. Zero Time features a deep black background adorned with the bold numeral 0. This unique layout challenges your perception of time, leaving you with a sense of timelessness and focus on the present moment.
